newsitem.title: CANADA: CBRS confirms Alberta Energy debt ratings.
newsitem.headline: CBRS confirms Alberta Energy debt ratings.

text.p: Canadian Bond Rating Service said on Thursday it confirmed Alberta Energy Co Ltd's debt securities after a review of the company's first-half results and said its outlook was positive.
CBRS said it confirmed its rating of A-1/Prime Quality on AEC's commercial paper and A/Good Quality on its long-term debt.

The ratings affect AEC's C$350 million commercial paper program and about C$475 million of senior notes and debentures, including C$200 million of medium-term notes issued through the use of a shelf facility.

Despite a weaker than expected second quarter because of an extended maintenance shutdown at Syncrude Canada Ltd and oil pipeline apportionment, AEC's first-half operational earnings were better than the year earlier period, the rating agency said, adding that was mostly because the company experienced no crude oil price hedge-in losses.
First-half cash flow was 45 percent higher, allowing the company to maintain an aggressive spending program while retaining a conservative capital structure, it said.
CBRS said AEC's production growth was expected to resume in the second half of this year and its financial risk profile remained strong despite weaker energy prices.
